action.action-desc: Mr. McIntyre introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To provide for the withdrawal of the United States from the North American Free Trade Agreement.

section.header: Withdrawal of the United States from the NAFTA

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the approval of the NAFTA by the Congress provided for in section 101(a) of the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act shall cease to be effective beginning on the date that is six months after the date of the enactment of this Act.

On the date of the enactment of this Act, the President shall provide to the Governments of Canada and Mexico written notice of withdrawal of the United States from the NAFTA in accordance with Article 2205 of the NAFTA.
In this section, the term NAFTA means the North American Free Trade Agreement entered into between the United States, Canada, and Mexico on December 17, 1992.
